entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hwǣr; akin to Old High German hwār where, Old English hwā who who

def.dt: :at, in, or to what place where is the house where are we going
:at, in, or to what situation, position, direction, circumstances, or respect where does this plan lead where am I wrong
:here there lo, where it comes again Shakespeare
:at, in, or to what place knows where the house is
:at, in, or to what situation, position, direction, circumstances, or respect shows where the plan leads
:the place or point at, in, or to which couldn't see from where he was sitting kept that horse and gentled him to where I finally rode him William Faulkner
:at, in, or to which place the town where she lives
:at or in which has reached the size where traffic is a problem two fireplaces where you can bake bread in the ovens Randall Jarrell
:at, in, or to the place at, in, or to which stay where you are send him away where he'll forget
:in a case, situation, or respect in which outstanding where endurance is called for
:that I've read where they do it that way in some Middle Eastern countries Andy Rooney
:place location the where and the how of the accident
:what place, source, or cause I know where that comes from
:a place of central interest or activity
:something (as a topic or field of interest) of primary concern or importance education is where it's at
